example.eg: She pointed to show where we should stand.
example.egtrans: 她指出了我们应该站的位置。

example.eg: The little boy pointed at the sky, following a plane with his finger.
example.egtrans: 那个小男孩指着天空，手指跟着一架飞机一起移动。

example.eg: All the signs point to Smith being the murderer.
example.egtrans: 所有迹象都表明，史密斯就是那个杀人凶手。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 指向, 指出, 表明

example.eg: There's a sharp point on this pencil.
example.egtrans: 这铅笔笔头很尖。

example.eg: We mustn't forget the point of the exercise.
example.egtrans: 我们绝不能忘掉练习的目的。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 中心, 重点, 重点

example.eg: I didn't grasp the point of what he was saying.
example.egtrans: 我没听明白他到底想说什么。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 主旨, 意义, 意义

example.eg: The value of pi is about three point one four.
example.egtrans: 圆周率的近似值是3.14。

example.eg: My speech is divided into three points.
example.egtrans: 我的讲话分为三点。

example.eg: Plot is not the film's strong point.
example.egtrans: 这个电影的优点不在情节上。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 特点, 特长, 特征

example.eg: Finally, the travellers saw a point of light in the distance.
example.egtrans: 最终，游客们远远地看到了一个光点。

example.eg: The water reached boiling point.
example.egtrans: 水达到了沸点。

example.eg: This train serves Birmingham and all points south.
example.egtrans: 这辆火车通往伯明翰以及南边的所有地点。

example.eg: The line cuts the circle at two separate points.
example.egtrans: 该线与圆相交于两点。

example.eg: At that point I realized the danger of the situation.
example.egtrans: 那一瞬间，我意识到了形势很危险。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 一时，一刻 ，时刻，瞬间，刹那

example.eg: The highest possible score in darts is 180 points.
example.egtrans: 飞镖游戏的最高分是180分。

dsense.name: point
dsense.guideword: (finance: hundredth of a cent) (金融，汇率)

example.eg: The dollar fell by eighty points against the yen.
example.egtrans: 美元兑日元下跌了80个点。

example.eg: The Dow Jones lost thirty-two points today.
example.egtrans: 道琼斯指数今天下跌了32个点。

example.eg: The main text should be twelve point; titles should be sixteen point.
example.egtrans: 正文应该用12磅值，标题应该用16磅值。

example.eg: There aren't enough power points for all our equipment.
example.egtrans: 这里的电插座数量不够，无法满足所有设备的需要。

example.eg: Every morning, Nancy rows around the point and back again.
example.egtrans: 每天早上，南希都会划船到岬的位置附近，再划回来。

example.eg: Every time I do the housework, the house just gets dirty again, so what's the point?  What's the point of putting on your best clothes if no one is going to see you?
Points allow the train to pass from one track to another.
The road points southerly.
example.egtrans: 这条路通向南方。

example.eg: Their house points towards the sea.
example.egtrans: 他们的房子面朝大海。

example.eg: Lift the gun, point and fire.
example.egtrans: 举起枪，瞄准，然后射击。

example.eg: The survey points to his deep unpopularity.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 表明, 显示, 体现

example.eg: Don't point that knife at me.
He has pointed all the brickwork.
She pointed us to the door.
example.egtrans: 她指给了我们门的位置。

example.eg: Could you point this pencil, please?
It was him, said the witness, pointing at the defendant.
All the evidence points at Mr. Smith.
If you hear the fire alarm, please make your way to the assembly point.
At one point, I thought we might even get married.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 某一刻, 在某一时间

example.eg: At some point, we'll need to decide whether the project is worth continuing.
example.egtrans: 某个时候，我们需要决定这个项目还值不值得继续下去。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 某个时刻，某个时候, 某个时间

example.eg: Honestly, I am really at the point of showing him the door.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 接近于, 濒临, 将近

example.eg: At this point, you have no choice but to find a job.
example.egtrans: 眼下，除了找工作以外你别无他法。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 这时候，此时此刻, 当下，眼下
此时此刻, 在这个时候

example.eg: Whether or not he's married is beside the point.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不是重点, 无关大局

example.eg: It is possible to change the boiling point of a liquid by changing the pressure around it.
Tempers reached boiling point when the referee sent one of the players off.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 爆发点，（怒火等）一触即发

example.eg: The physics students are testing the breaking points of different metals.
example.egtrans: 物理系学生正在测试不同金属的强度极限。

example.eg: Tony was under a lot of stress and he eventually reached breaking point.
I'm cooking dinner tonight; that should earn me a few Brownie points with my mother.

dsense.name: bullet point
dsense.guideword: (dot before list item) (有圆点、正方形、菱形及其他图案)

example.eg: The boss would prefer a simple list of items with bullet points, rather than long descriptions.  To create a list of bullet points, click on the icon.
example.egtrans: 老板想要的是逐项简明罗列，而不是冗长的描述。要想在条目前标记符号，请点击这个图标。

dsense.name: cardinal point, cardinal direction
dsense.guideword: usually plural (one of 4 main compass points)

example.eg: North, south, east, and west are the cardinal points of the compass.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 方位基点, 基本方位点

example.eg: Movies can encourage children to read. The Harry Potter series is a case in point.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 例证, 很好的例子, 恰当的例子

example.eg: The valley was a choke point for the advancing army.
The narrow bridge across the river is a choke point for traffic.
I have come to a point in my life where I do not like to party every night.
The teacher taught the students how to give directions using the compass points.
She likes tequila, but two drinks is her cut-off point on work nights.

dsense.name: cutoff point, also UK: cut-off point

example.eg: The cutoff point for sending in applications is 1st November.
You need a decimal point between those two figures; there's a big difference between 6.25 and 625.
It was so humid this morning that the dew point was above 10 degrees Celsius.
There is a warehouse at the port that serves as a drop-off point, we collect the merchandise there.
The end points are several hundred metres apart.
The proposed diversion alters the end point of the footpath.
The entry point of the bullet is below the exit wound suggesting that a short person fired the gun at Mr. Jones.
The easiest way to get a visa is on arrival, either at airports or at entry points to the country.
It is considered poor style to use too many exclamation points when writing.
Police were quickly dispatched to the flashpoint.
Holiday gatherings can be a flashpoint for some families.
Drawings of 3D objects have to have a single focal point to look realistic.
The Monet painting was the focal point of the room.

dsense.name: freezing point
dsense.guideword: (temperature: liquid turns solid) (液体变成固体的临界温度)

example.eg: Every liquid has a different freezing point; that of pure water is zero Celsius.
The rest of the climb will be much easier from this point.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 从这时开始, 从此时起

example.eg: From this point forward I won't smoke in the house any more.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 从现在开始, 从此时起

example.eg: The lecturer was getting off the point and some of the students had stopped paying attention.

dsense.name: get to the point, come to the point

example.eg: It took Natalie a long time to get to the point.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 谈到正题, 说到要害

example.eg: Get to the point! We haven't got all day, you know.
Miriam raised several good points during the discussion.
"Some people won't be able to attend the meeting if we hold it on Friday." "Good point!"
One of Hugh's good points is his generosity.

dsense.name: GPA
dsense.guideword: US, initialism (grade point average) (grade point average的缩写形式)

example.eg: Molly has the highest GPA in the 9th grade.
She'd gotten straight A's all through high school so she had a 4.0 grade point average.
Gudrun has a point; we should leave early tomorrow in order to avoid the traffic.
The high point of my holiday was the whale-watching trip.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最精彩的时刻, 最佳状态

example.eg: Learning the alphabet is a good jumping off point for children who wish to learn how to read.

dsense.name: labor the point (US), labour the point (UK)

example.eg: The lawyer labored the point excessively.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 过分详尽地阐述, 过分多说

example.eg: The low point in the athlete's career was when a leg injury forced him to miss the Olympic Games.
James was at a low point at that time because he had just split up with his girlfriend.
I reached my lowest point just after my wife left me.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 低谷, 最低点, 低潮

example.eg: The chairman presented the main points of the report to the meeting.
Will you stop interrupting me? I'm trying to make a point here!
This chef makes a point of cooking with locally sourced ingredients.
I make a point of donating to a charity every Christmas.
Dale was struggling to make his point during the debate.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 说服他人同意自己的观点, 证明自己的观点, 表明自己的态度

dsense.name: match point
dsense.guideword: (tennis, etc.: point that wins a match) (一方还差一分赢得比赛的情况)

example.eg: Federer only needed one match point to win the game with Nadal.
They settled on the library as a meeting point because it was near both their houses.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 集合地点, 见面地点

dsense.name: melting point
dsense.guideword: (temperature at which a solid turns to liquid)

example.eg: Bronze has a lower melting point than iron.
You're missing the point: this isn't about pay - it's about conditions.
It is a moot point whether sex education among teenagers leads to fewer unwanted pregnancies.
Wondering about how things were before the birth of the universe is a moot point.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 无实际意义所以不值得争辩的问题

example.eg: The near point for someone with normal vision is 25 cm.

dsense.name: there's no use in doing [sth], there's no point doing [sth], there's no point in doing [sth]

example.eg: There's no point in asking Jake if you can borrow his car; he'll say no.  There's no use in telling me now that I shouldn't put that vase there; you should have mentioned it before I knocked it over and broke it.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 没有用的, 无济于事的, 于事无补的

example.eg: People go before a judge because they want an objective point of view.
Along the coastal road are various observation points, at which drivers may stop and admire the view.
The country's largest bank is on the point of collapse.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 面临，濒临, 几近，接近

example.eg: She was on the point of leaving when he finally arrived.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 正在…的时候, 即将, 濒临

example.eg: This app's limited functionality on certain operating systems is a pain point with customers.
I scored 88%; two percentage points away from getting an A.
It is difficult to pinpoint exactly why this problem has occurred.
example.egtrans: 很难找出之所以会出现这个问题的确切原因。

example.eg: We know our agent is in this area, but we can't pinpoint his location at the moment.
example.egtrans: 我知道我们的经纪人就在这个区域，但目前却无法确定他的准确位置。

example.eg: Global warming was the main point at issue of the conference.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 当前正在讨论的话题, 争论的议题

example.eg: She shot him point blank, killing him instantly.
Amanda rejected David's proposal point blank.
Could we please return to the point in question?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 当前正在讨论的问题, 争论的问题
争论焦点, 辩论焦点

example.eg: Our point of departure for the journey will be the Port of Los Angeles.
We're not going to discuss the presentation itself, but we will take it as our point of departure.
There are many points of interest along the highway, especially for lovers of history and geology.
